introduction.description: PHP (Hypertext Preprocessor) is a widely-used, open-source server-side scripting language designed for web development. It can also be embedded into HTML and used for building dynamic web pages and applications.

steps: Download XAMPP, WAMP, or MAMP based on your OS.
Access your server through 'localhost' or a similar local server URL.

syntax_basics.file_extension: Save the file with a .php extension (e.g., index.php) and access it through your web server (e.g., http://localhost/index.php).

variables.description: Variables in PHP are declared using a $ symbol.

constants.definition: Constants are defined using define() and cannot be changed.

conditionals.if_example:
<?php
  $age = 20;
  if ($age > 18) {
    echo 'You are an adult.';
  } else {
    echo 'You are a minor.';
  }
?>

default_arguments.example:
<?php
  function greet($name = 'Guest') {
    return "Hello, $name!";
  }
  echo greet(); // Output: Hello, Guest!
?>

form_handling.description: PHP can handle form data sent using GET or POST methods.

get_vs_post.get: GET appends data to the URL.
get_vs_post.post: POST sends data in the request body.

class_definition.example:
<?php
  class Person {
    public $name;
    public function __construct($name) {
      $this->name = $name;
    }
    public function greet() {
      return 'Hello, ' . $this->name . '!';
    }
  }
  $p = new Person('Alice');
  echo $p->greet();
?>

next_steps.description: Learn about MySQL integration with PHP for databases and explore frameworks like Laravel. Practice building dynamic web applications.
